channel.title: Webinars on Young-ISA
channel.description: Recent content in Webinars on Young-ISA

item.title: Condition based maintenance - a guideline for choosing between repair and replacement
item.description: Dr. Elham Mosayebi Omshi will speak on an adapted maintenance modeling framework for modeling the maintenance cost of a system.

item.title: Efficient Conversion Probability Estimator for Display Advertising
item.description: Dr. Abdollah Safari from faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences, University of British Colombia will speak on methods to estimate the conversion probability of an advertisement to quantify the value of an ad.

item.title: Introductory data science, a fresh look
item.description: Dr. Mine Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel from the School of Mathematics, University of Edinburgh; Department of Statistical Science, Duke University; and RStudio will speak on a fresh approach to teaching data science at the introductory level and will introduce the design philosophy behind the curriculum as well as provide directions in assessment in this online teaching era.

item.title: An introduction to the tidymodels package
item.description: Bruna Wundervald from the School of Mathematics, National University of Ireland, Maynooth will introduce tidymodels packages, and how they can be used for the pre-processing of data, and training and validation of machine learning models.

item.title: Clustering Big Data with Mixed Features
item.description: Joshua Tobin from the School of Computer Science & Statistics, Trinity College Dublin, will introduce a new clustering method for large mixed attribute datasets which adapts and extends the popular peak-finding technique. The algorithm presented is competent at deciding the correct number of clusters and executes with subquadratic complexity.

item.title: Global Short-Term Forecasting of Covid-19 Cases
item.description: Dr. Thiago de Paula Oliveira from the Roslin Institute, University of Edinburgh will speak on a new modelling framework of COVID-19 to forecast the number of cases, study the effects of covariates (such as lockdown policies), and generate forecasts for smaller regions within countries and up to six days ahead.
